dateAndTime.dateTimeYearAlrt: Please enter a year between 1970 and 2031.
dateAndTime.dateTimeInvalDateAlrt: Please enter an (existing) date using the format: yyyy-mm-dd
dateAndTime.dateTimeInvalTimeAlrt: Please enter a (valid) time in the format: hh:mm:ss or hh:mm.

ip.ipPlSpMultiCaAlrt: Please specify the Internet Multicast address in the format a.b.c.d, with values between 224.0.0.0 to 239.255.255.255.
ip.ipPlSpMultiCaAlrt2: Please specify the Internet Multicast address in the Ipv6 multicastformat
ip.ipPlSpFormatAlrt: Please specify the Internet address in the format a.b.c.d, with each field having a number in the range 0 to 255.
ip.ipUnrechableIPAlrt:
is most likely to render the unit unreachable, in which case a factory default is required to regain access.
Are you absolutely sure you want to do this?
ip.ipProbUnvalidAlrt:
The ip address ending with either 0 or 255 is usually invalid and could render the camera inaccessible, in which case a reset to factory default settings is required to regain access.
Are you absolutely sure you want to do this?
ip.ipBinZeroIPAlrt: The IP adress is zero at the binary host part of the subnet mask. This might cause problems. Are you sure you want to continue?
ip.ipBroadCastIPAlrt: The IP adress specified is usually the broadcast adress. This might cause problems. Are you sure you want to continue?
ip.ipToMaIntIPAlrt: Too many integers. An IP number must contain four integers between 0 and 255.
ip.ipFourIntsIPAlrt: An IP number must contain four integers (separated by a dot) between 0 and 255.
ip.ipEachPartIPAlrt: Each part of the IP number must be an integer between 0 and 255.
ip.ipFourIntSMAlrt: A subnet mask must contain 4 integers between 0 and 255.
ip.ipEachPartSMAlrt: Each part of the subnet mask must be an integer between 0 and 255.
ip.ipUnrechableSMAlrt:
Using this subnet mask may render the camera unreachable.
Are you sure you want to use the subnet mask anyway?
